titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Alfred White Van Sinderen Collection of Charles Babbage
Van Sinderen (Alfred White) Collection of Charles Babbage
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Karen Spicher

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 1, 2019 at 04:03

did.unittitle: Alfred White Van Sinderen collection of Charles Babbage

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Correspondence of Charles Babbage, writings by Babbage, and other related papers collected by Alfred White Van Sinderen. Correspondence, circa 1810-1864 and undated, consists of autograph letters, signed, most from Babbage to colleagues, friends, and others; also present are a few letters to Babbage and third party letters. Correspondents include Alexander Dallas Bache; Michael Faraday; William Henry Fitton; Benjamin Hawes; Ada King, Countess of Lovelace; and Peter Mark Roget. Writings by Babbage include a untitled poem, autograph manuscript, circa 1817-1820, about Babbage's unsuccessful efforts to obtain an academic appointment; "To the Electors of Finsbury," 1832 November 12, printed proof, about Babbage's views during the Parliamentary election; and an autograph manuscript account book, 1810-1827. Most correspondence and writings are accompanied by typed transcripts and notes made by Van Sinderen. Other papers include additional notes by Van Sinderen and vendor descriptions for books by Babbage.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Alfred White Van Sinderen (Yale 1945), 1991 and 1998.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Alfred White Van Sinderen Collection of Charles Babbage is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Alfred White Van Sinderen Collection of Charles Babbage. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Former call numbers: Uncat Ms Vault 809 and Uncat Ms Vault File. In 2015, the collection received a baseline level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization. The collection was reclassed under one call number, and containers were renumbered. Most folder titles were based on information provided by the donor, while some were assigned by Library staff. Folder titles were not verified against contents.

bioghist.head: Alfred White Van Sinderen (1924-1998) (Yale 1945)
bioghist.p: Southern New England Telecommunications Corporation executive, 1947-1985; faculty fellow, Yale University School of Organization and Management; and Yale University Library Associates trustee. Van Sinderen assembled his collection of books and manuscripts relating to Charles Babbage during the 1960s through 1990s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence of Charles Babbage, writings by Babbage, and other related papers collected by Alfred White Van Sinderen. Correspondence, circa 1810-1864 and undated, consists of autograph letters, signed, most from Babbage to colleagues, friends, and others; also present are a few letters to Babbage and third party letters. Correspondents include Alexander Dallas Bache; Michael Faraday; William Henry Fitton; Benjamin Hawes; Ada King, Countess of Lovelace; and Peter Mark Roget. Writings by Babbage include a untitled poem, autograph manuscript, circa 1817-1820, about Babbage's unsuccessful efforts to obtain an academic appointment; "To the Electors of Finsbury," 1832 November 12, printed proof, about Babbage's views during the Parliamentary election; and an autograph manuscript account book, 1810-1827. Most correspondence and writings are accompanied by typed transcripts and notes by Van Sinderen. Other papers include additional notes made by Van Sinderen and vendor descriptions for books by Babbage.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: I. Correspondence of Charles Babbage, 1810-1864. II. Writings of Charles Babbage, 1810-1832. III. Other Papers, 1700s-1990s.

scopecontent.p: Letters are from Babbage, unless otherwise noted in file title.
